channel.title: [C4D] Good and Evil rings
channel.description:
Its been a while since i've posted something, and this is just one of the things ive made while getting used to r11's GI.
[img]http://fc37.deviantart.com/fs42/f/2009/074/f/a/Good_and_Evil_Rings_by_Frell262.png[/img]

item.title: [C4D] Good and Evil rings
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Wow, nice job Frell; I could never do the rings that well.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Good and Evil rings
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:5, topic:267684”]It’s cool.

I’d say to look for some downloadable gold and silver materials. Look at what they’ve done. Gold/Silver is a lot more than just a little reflection and color tinting. Even I can’t make realistic gold or silver. Learn from other people.[/quote]
I used a danel shader, with the anstrospy or whatever turned on, it gave it a scratchy look, but it all disappeared in the GI and now it looks dull and simple

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Good and Evil rings
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Archer, post:6, topic:267684”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=353381.msg2709010#msg2709010 date=1237167175]

It’s cool.

I’d say to look for some downloadable gold and silver materials. Look at what they’ve done. Gold/Silver is a lot more than just a little reflection and color tinting. Even I can’t make realistic gold or silver. Learn from other people.
[/quote]

That’s what I do, even after all this time lol.[/quote]

Shit I do too.

Just with gold/silver. And I always play with it as well.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Good and Evil rings
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:3, topic:267684”]Not much to say on the model cause it’s simple.

Materials need work if you’re going for gold and silver. What renderer are you using?[/quote]
r11’s GI.

They looked good before i used the GI, they were scratched metal and looked textured. It all went away with the GI.

Read full topic
